detaileddescription.para: (0x0) Network key
(0x1) Application key

briefdescription.para: Specify the type of a key in key manipulation commands.

detaileddescription.para: Get the network transmit state of a node.

parameterdescription.para: Number of network layer transmissions beyond the initial one. Range: 0-7.

Transmit interval steps. The interval between transmissions is a random value between 10*(1+steps) and 10*(2+steps) milliseconds. For example, for a value of 2, the interval is between 30 and 40 milliseconds. Range: 0-31.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set the network transmit state of a node locally. Normally, the network transmit state is controlled by the Provisioner. This command overrides any setting done by the Provisioner.

parameterdescription.para: Number of network layer transmissions beyond the initial one. Range: 0-7.

Transmit interval steps. The interval between transmissions is a random value between 10*(1+steps) and 10*(2+steps) milliseconds. For example, for a value of 2 the interval would be between 30 and 40 milliseconds. Range: 0-31.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: State value indicating whether the relay functionality is not enabled on the node (0), is enabled on the node (1), or is not available (2).
Number of relay transmissions beyond the initial one. Range: 0-7.
Relay retransmit interval steps. The interval between transmissions is 10*(1+steps) milliseconds. Range: 0-31.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set the relay state and the relay retransmit state of a node locally. Normally, these states are controlled by the Provisioner. This command overrides any settings done by the Provisioner.

parameterdescription.para: Indicates whether the relay functionality is enabled on the node (1) or not (0); value indicating disabled (2) can't be set.
Number of relay transmissions beyond the initial one. Range: 0-7.
Relay retransmit interval steps. The interval between transmissions is 10*(1+steps) milliseconds. Range: 0-31.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t adv_interval_min, uint16_t adv_interval_max, uint8_t adv_repeat_packets, uint8_t adv_use_random_address, uint8_t adv_channel_map, uint16_t scan_interval, uint16_t scan_window)
memberdef.name: sl_btmesh_test_set_adv_scan_params

detaileddescription.para: Set the non-default advertisement and scanning parameters used in mesh communications. Call this command before sl_btmesh_node_init or sl_btmesh_prov_init for the settings to take effect.

parameterdescription.para: Minimum advertisement interval. Value is in units of 0.625 ms. Default value is 1 (0.625 ms).
Maximum advertisement interval. Value is in units of 0.625 ms. Must be equal to or greater than the minimum interval. Default value is 32 (20 ms).
Number of times to repeat each packet on all selected advertisement channels. Range: 1-5. Default value is 1.
Bluetooth address type. Range: 0: use public address, 1: use random address. Default value: 0 (public address).
Advertisement channel selection bitmask. Range: 0x1-0x7. Default value: 7 (all channels)
Scan interval. Value is in units of 0.625 ms. Range: 0x0004 to 0x4000 (time range of 2.5 ms to 10.24 s). Default value is 160 (100 ms).
Scan window. Value is in units of 0.625 ms. Must be equal to or less than the scan interval.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: By default, IV index update is limited in how often the update procedure can be performed. This test command can be called to set IV update test mode where any time limits are ignored.

parameterdescription.para: Whether test mode is enabled (1) or disabled (0).

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current IV update test mode. See sl_btmesh_test_set_ivupdate_test_mode for details.

parameterdescription.para: Indicates whether test mode is enabled (1) or disabled (0).

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set the delay in milliseconds between sending consecutive segments of a segmented message. The default value is 0. Note that this command needs to be called before sl_btmesh_node_init or sl_btmesh_prov_init for the settings to take effect.

parameterdescription.para: Number of milliseconds to delay each segment after the first

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Forcefully change the IV update state on the device. Normally, the state changes as a result of an IV index update procedure progressing from one state to the next.

parameterdescription.para: Indicates whether IV update state should be entered (1) or exited (0).

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Send secure network beacons for every network key on the device, regardless of beacon configuration state or how many beacons sent by other devices have been observed.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

Vendor ID for vendor-specific models. Use 0xffff for Bluetooth SIG models.
Model ID

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t elem_index, uint16_t appkey_index, uint16_t vendor_id, uint16_t model_id, uint16_t pub_address, uint8_t ttl, uint8_t period, uint8_t retrans, uint8_t credentials)
memberdef.name: sl_btmesh_test_set_local_model_pub

detaileddescription.para: Set a local model's publication address, key, and parameters.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the target element, where 0 is the primary element
The application key index to use for the application messages published
Vendor ID for vendor-specific models. Use 0xffff for Bluetooth SIG models.
Model ID
The address to publish to
Time-to-Live value for published messages

Publication period encoded as step count and step resolution. The encoding is as follows:
Bits 0..5: Step count
Bits 6..7: Step resolution:
00: 100 milliseconds
01: 1 second
10: 10 seconds
11: 10 minutes

parblock.para: Retransmission count and interval, which controls number of times that the model re-publishes the same message after the initial publish transmission and the cadence of retransmissions.
Retransmission count is encoded in the three low bits of the value, ranging from 0 to 7. Default value is 0 (no retransmissions).
Retransmission interval is encoded in the five high bits of the value, ranging from 0 to 31, in 50-millisecond units. Value of 0 corresponds to 50 ms, while value of 31 corresponds to 1600 ms.

parameterdescription.para: Friendship credentials flag

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t elem_index, uint16_t appkey_index, uint16_t vendor_id, uint16_t model_id, uint8_t ttl, uint8_t period, uint8_t retrans, uint8_t credentials, size_t pub_address_len, const uint8_t *pub_address)
memberdef.name: sl_btmesh_test_set_local_model_pub_va

detaileddescription.para: Set a model's publication virtual address, key, and parameters.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the target element, 0 is the primary element
The application key index to use for the published messages
Vendor ID of the configured model. Use 0xffff for Bluetooth SIG models.
Model ID of the configured model
Publication time-to-live value

Publication period encoded as step count and step resolution. The encoding is as follows:
Bits 0..5: Step count
Bits 6..7: Step resolution:
00: 100 milliseconds
01: 1 second
10: 10 seconds
11: 10 minutes
See documentation of sl_btmesh_test_set_local_model_pub for details.
Friendship credentials flag
Length of data in pub_address
The Label UUID to publish to. The byte array must be exactly 16 bytes long.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t elem_index, uint16_t vendor_id, uint16_t model_id, uint16_t *appkey_index, uint16_t *pub_address, uint8_t *ttl, uint8_t *period, uint8_t *retrans, uint8_t *credentials)

detaileddescription.para: Get a local model's publication address, key, and parameters.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the target element, 0 is the primary element
Vendor ID for vendor-specific models. Use 0xffff for Bluetooth SIG models.
Model ID
The application key index used for the application messages published
The address published to
Time-to-Live value for published messages

Publication period encoded as step count and step resolution. The encoding is as follows:
Bits 0..5: Step count
Bits 6..7: Step resolution:
00: 100 milliseconds
01: 1 second
10: 10 seconds
11: 10 minutes
See documentation of sl_btmesh_test_set_local_model_pub for details.
Friendship credentials flag

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set local node heartbeat subscription parameters. Normally heartbeat subscription is controlled by the Provisioner.

parameterdescription.para: Source address for heartbeat messages. Must be either a unicast address or the unassigned address, in which case heartbeat messages are not processed.

Destination address for heartbeat messages. The address must be either the unicast address of the primary element of the node, a group address, or the unassigned address. If it is the unassigned address, heartbeat messages are not processed.

Heartbeat subscription period setting. Valid values are as follows:
0x00: Heartbeat messages are not received
0x01 .. 0x11: Node will receive heartbeat messages for 2^(n-1) seconds
0x12 .. 0xff: Prohibited

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Get the local node heartbeat subscription. state

parameterdescription.para: Number of received heartbeat messages
Minimum observed hop count in heartbeat messages
Maximum observed hop count in heartbeat messages

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Get the heartbeat publication state of a local node.

parameterdescription.para: Heartbeat publication address
Heartbeat publication remaining count

Heartbeat publication period setting. Valid values are as follows:
0x00: Heartbeat messages are not sent
0x01 .. 0x11: Node will send a heartbeat message every 2^(n-1) seconds
0x12 .. 0xff: Prohibited
Time-to-live parameter for heartbeat messages
Heartbeat trigger setting
Index of the network key used to encrypt heartbeat messages

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t publication_address, uint8_t count_log, uint8_t period_log, uint8_t ttl, uint16_t features, uint16_t publication_netkey_index)
memberdef.name: sl_btmesh_test_set_local_heartbeat_publication

detaileddescription.para: Set the heartbeat publication state of a local node.

parameterdescription.para: Heartbeat publication address. The address can't be a virtual address. Note that it can be the unassigned address, in which case the heartbeat publishing is disabled.

Heartbeat publication count setting. Valid values are as follows:
0x00: Heartbeat messages are not sent
0x01 .. 0x11: Node will send 2^(n-1) heartbeat messages
0x12 .. 0xfe: Prohibited
0xff: Hearbeat messages are sent indefinitely

Heartbeat publication period setting. Valid values are as follows:
0x00: Heartbeat messages are not sent
0x01 .. 0x11: Node will send a heartbeat message every 2^(n-1) seconds
0x12 .. 0xff: Prohibited
Time-to-live parameter for heartbeat messages

parblock.para:
Heartbeat trigger setting. For bits set in the bitmask, reconfiguration of the node feature associated with the bit will result in the node emitting a heartbeat message. Valid values are as follows:
Bit 0: Relay feature
Bit 1: Proxy feature
Bit 2: Friend feature
Bit 3: Low power feature
Remaining bits are reserved for future use.

parameterdescription.para: Index of the network key used to encrypt heartbeat messages

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t id, uint16_t netkey_index, size_t value_len, const uint8_t *value)

The new value

Key data
Index for the added key (must be unused)
Network key index to which the application key is bound; ignored for network keys

Index of the key to delete

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Update the network or application key value locally.
Copies the existing network key value to the old value and replaces the current value with the given key data.
Note that the standard way to update keys on the Provisioner as well as on nodes is to run the key refresh procedure. This command is for debugging only.

parameterdescription.para: Enum sl_btmesh_test_key_type_t. 0 for network key, 1 for application key
Key data
Index for the key to update

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t incomplete_timer_ms, uint32_t pending_ack_base_ms, uint32_t pending_ack_mul_ms, uint32_t wait_for_ack_base_ms, uint32_t wait_for_ack_mul_ms, uint8_t max_send_rounds)
memberdef.name: sl_btmesh_test_set_sar_config

detaileddescription.para: Change the transport layer segmentation and reassembly configuration values. This command must be issued before initializing the Mesh stack or the changes will not take effect.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum timeout before a transaction expires, regardless of other parameters. Value is in milliseconds. Default = 10000 (10 seconds).
Base time to wait at the receiver before sending a transport layer acknowledgment. Value is in milliseconds. Default = 150.
TTL multiplier to add to the base acknowledgment timer. Value is in milliseconds. Default = 50.
Base time to wait for an acknowledgment at the sender before retransmission. Value is in milliseconds. Default = 200.
TTL multiplier to add to the base retransmission timer. Value is in milliseconds. Default = 50.
Number of attempts to send fragments of a segmented message, including the initial TX. Default = 3.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Disable or enable advertisement bearer for sending.

parameterdescription.para: 0: disable advertisement, 1: enable advertisement.

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Get the device key with the address of the node's primary element.

parameterdescription.para: Address of the node
Device key, 16-bytes

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Prepare the key refresh by feeding the new network key and all needed application keys. The function can be called multiple times to include more application keys. The network key must be the same in all calls. If the network key is changed, the network key from the 1st command is used. Sending application key data with length zero results in all initialization data being forgotten unless this is done in the first prepare command i.e., trying to update only the network key. Also starting the key refresh procedure results in all the preparation data being forgotten.

parameterdescription.para: New net key
Length of data in app_keys
list of new application keys, 16-bytes each

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Cancel sending a segmented message.

parameterdescription.para: Source address for the segmented message
Destination address for the segmented message

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set the IV index value of the node.

parameterdescription.para: IV Index value to use

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set the current sequence number of an element.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the target element, 0 is the primary element
Sequence number to set on the target element

simplesect.para: SL_STATUS_OK if successful. Error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: These commands are meant for development and testing. Do not use in production software.
